section.title: Will
section.sectiontitle: Use will + verb to make predictions about the future. A prediction is something that we think will happen. The negative of will is won't (will not).
section.text1a: The number of tourists will double in the near future.
section.text2a: He won't want to eat when he gets home.
section.sectiontitle2: We often use I (don't) think or I hope with will.
section.text3a: I don't think he'll be here early.
section.text4a: I hope inflation won't rise again.

section.title: Will
section.sectiontitle: Also use will for promises and things that you decide at the moment of speaking.
section.text1a: I'll give you the money tomorrow.
section.text2a: I don't know where she is. I think I'll call her mobile.
section.sectiontitle2: Use shall for suggestions and to ask for other people's preferences.
section.text3a: Shall we have chicken for dinner?
section.text4a: Where shall we go on holiday this year?
